bibl.title: A Jewish Place of Prayer in Roman Egypt.
bibl.note: The Jewish nature of S.B. III, 6832 [ed.: William Sherwood FOX, Greek Inscriptions in the Royal Ontario Museum, AJP 38 (1917) pp. 411-412, No. 2], provenance unknown, early Roman period. ProseuxÆ, 'place of prayer', indicates the building which later became known as sunagvgÆ. The name PapoËw was apparently used by Egyptian Jews. <proseuche, sunagoge, Papous>
NOY David, A Jewish Place of Prayer in Roman Egypt.
